author: prem.konma
title: Konma Labz
description: Lack of talent pool and awareness for the development of smart contracts, API's, Oracles and other Dapps using Haskell/Plutus.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal clearly and concisely describes how it will address the  of the issue the proposal is addresses the challenge of their being a lack of talent to develop smart contracts and Dapps with Haskell and Plutus. It also acknowledges that there is a lack of awareness that these systems even exists, they provide a solution which aims to build an incubation centre for Cardanao's ecosystem with the talent from EMURGO India that looks to address this issue.

By building and growing that talent pool through incubation of crypto and Dapps development fundamentals, the Cardano ecosystem will be positively impacted since Dapps, Haskell and Plutus knowledge will be more readily available to industry partners or entrepreneurs. Since the proposal focuses on the talent pool from EMURGO India it is particularly pertinent for Cardano's mission for its global adoption and growth of its ecosystem. 

As Konma Labz will be assessing performance close monitoring and bi-weekly reviews of code, bugs and vulnerabilities in the code base, it aligns well with the challenge brief. However additional metrics could be added in this instance, such as number of users participating in testnets, listings on DEX's and active users that the cohort is attracting.

In terms of scalability the proposal sets out plans beyond for a 24 week period, there would be benefit for mentioning plans for once the program is complete. For example will it be re-run or expanded into other areas of India. Or will perhaps Konma Labz look to apply for funding in Fund 8.
f6_assessments.q1:
Konma labz is the research arm of https://www.konma.community/ which has a focus of developing and neutering communities. If the ethos of community creation can be applied to developing a Cardano cohort within India successfully then significant value will be to the ecosystem. 

From digging into the Konma organisation through Linkdin and job listing it's not apparent of the blockchain skills, however they do appear to have fielded a number of proposals from, Konma DAO, Konma Swap, ADA Pay and several others that show they have a fair understanding of the Cardano ecosystem. It's mentioned that they have attended many hackathons, the proposal would have benefited from publishing the hackathon results and findings and this would have demonstrated their skills to have a successful project in a tangible way. 

The plan identifies skills required to implement the proposal from product development, project management block chain engineering skills, Web3 Development, and others. It would appear that Konma Labz is able to draw from its existing team to fulfill those skill requirements. Their current team consists of various levels of developers that have a working knowledge of Haskell, Plutus, Mithril, Oroborus and Atala Prism all of which would give the team solid fundamentals to execute on the plan. 

A clear and concise budget breakdown is provided outlining how capital will be spent, it makes it clear there will be a heavy focus on development cost. Aligning the spending plan with the roadmap it shows there has been rigour in planning out how development effort will take place. In addition to this the timeline isn't such a long period that it would be unachievable, it appears that there is a short enough iteration for the goals of the proposal to be achievable. There would be benefit in outlining what would happen in the case of overspend and they are no longer able to continue, for example would Konma Labz bank role the remaining program if there was no money left over. 

Konma in their proposal go someway to identify some challenges such as the first batch of the EMURGO India developers will lack hands on experience, however it would be useful to provide some mitigations for this risk. In addition to this risk of lack of hands on experienced pointed out in the proposal, there would be value in highlighting further risks to the project and how those would be overcome.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a good time horizon and roadmap which could be use to audit progress of project. Some points on the roadmap have verifiable actions which enable audibility such as  auditing, deploying to a test net, a beta program, and of course an ICO which will be the end outcome. Participation in any of these steps will mean that the project has sufficient checks, balances and measured against KPI's such as the number of participants and holders of tokens. As one of the steps they mention creating a community collaboration campaigns which will raise awareness enable participants to be involved and track progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This clearly identifies a problem in that a pool of talented developers is crucial for the success of Cardano DeFI. Hence they seek to create an incubator where entrepreneurs can find these talented developers. 

One point of improvement would be to exactly explain why this pool of developers would actually join the Labz. What is the added value of your incubator?
f6_assessments.q1: Not much information is provided about the team but through further digging one could find their LinkedIn pages. They have some people with engineering background and with technical background. They have worked in a wide range of sectors but not specifically with incubation of this type. Hence, it is quite unclear whether they will successfully launch a high-quality incubator. Next time, more detailed evidence should be supplemented in the form of team members and exactly who participated in what hackathon as well as the work on oracles (github repo?)
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is very clear given the weekly breakdown. However, further breakdown of the expected infrastructure would be needed for full points in this category.

f6_assessments.q0: Currently there aren't many developer that understands Haskell/Plutus for building dApp on Cardano. As a Plutus Pioneer myself, it's a huge learning curve from regular everyday programming language (e.g javascript, python, etc) to learn this Haskell for building smart-contract and such. This proposal tries to build Konma Labz, which is some kind of research and development centre, for people to be able to learn together and guide them (developing on Cardano) from industry expert. This proposal aligned with challenge goals, which will focuses on building an incubation centre for blockchain and Cardano's ecosystem in particular.
f6_assessments.q1: Konma have a lot of different proposal throughout this Fund 7, and Konma Labz is one of them. This proposal trying to build a physical lab (Konma Labz) in Konma Xperience centre, located in India (for their first centre). They will find experienced people for this project through talent pool from EMURGO India in 2022, aligned with EMURGO's program graduation schedule. This proposal breaks down the budget in details, laid out the team needed for the team, also have the roadmap explained in details. They also have the team member profile on their website, from the founder, head of research, to their head of technology. Considering from their experience and preparedness, this project have high chance of success. Keep in mind that there are 7 proposal for this Konma Organization in this Fund 7, that shows dedication and hardships.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is clearly explained in weekly basis, although not in a very detailed manner. The metrics and KPIs is clearly laid out, and manage to explain the solution needed for given problem. The audit process should be tracked easily, as this project plans seek help and guidance from Mlabs (Blockchain consultant for Haskell and Rust), IOHK, COTI, and Emurgo.

solution: Create & deploy Konma Labz, consisting of Haskell/Plutus developers to further help businesses develop DeFi projects on the Cardano chain.
experience: Konma Labz has attended many hackathons. Using IoT and oracles architecture to advance blockchain technology in 15 sectors.
